column4: does anyone know what happened to System > Administration > Disks in Edgy? I don't see it anymore
I think it has become GNOME Partition Manager
s/Manager/Editor/
I don't see it either; or is the partition editor just not an icon in System > Administration?
I have it there.
you have System > Administration > Partition Editor ?
yes
I don't
I don't have it in my menu, and it doesn't appear as an unselected choice for it in System > Preferences > Menu Layout
I don't know then.
It might have been something unusual with the upgrade.
You did have ubuntu-desktop installed, right?
yes.
My installation was done with debootstrap, a loop mounted edgy iso, and a dapper livecd, so my installation may be unusual, but let me check it.
gparted doesn't _appear_ to be installed by default except on the livecd. Maybe you should ask whether it has been removed on #ubuntu-devel.
but do you have Disks, then? I mean, my initial question really amounted to: "That's weird, I don't seem to have any way to manage my disks anymore in Edgy"
No, I don't have disks.
But the way your question is going, you should probably ask on devel
ah, so it seems to be the case that the disk management tool is just no longer offered.
what's devel?
#ubuntu-devel
The channel for ubuntu development.
oh lol, okay.
I didn't know this existed.
